content: foxglove by annie baker anniebakerdesigns com foxglove is an asymmetrical cowl neck poncho knit in the round from the top down using stockinette stitch cowl and bottom edges are knit in garter stitch bottom slit on short side of poncho allows for ease of arm movement and can be worn on left or right side you will need a minimum of 1 575 meters / 1 722 yards wollmeise lace yarn pictured poncho is size 2 shown on us size 12 dressform enjoy materials 1 575 meters / 1 722 yards or more wollmeise lace weight yarn 3 25 mm / us 3 / uk 10 circular needles 24 and 40 2 75 mm / us 2 / uk 12 circular needles 24 and 40 2 stitch markers and 1 unique stitch marker gauge stockinette stitch before blocking 28 stitches and 40 row = 4 inches after blocking 27 stitches and 38 row = 4 inches measurements approximate after blocking size 1 24 75 inch cowl / neck opening diameter size 2 26 50 inch cowl / neck opening diameter size 3 28 25 inch cowl / neck opening diameter suggested sizing size 1 bust measurement up to 39 inches size 2 bust measurement 40 to 44 inches size 3 bust measurement over 44 inches also use cowl / neck opening measurements as a guide stitches and techniques used stockinette stitch garter stitch lifted left and right increases long tail cast on or your favorite stretchy cast on method ©copyright 2013 annie baker all rights reserved this pattern may be used for distribute this pattern notes  instructions are written for two sizes as follows size1 size2 size3  minimum yarn requirement is 1 575 meters 1 722 yards more if you prefer a longer poncho  cast on loosely using long tail method or use your favorite stretchy cast on method  try on as you knit to check length  you will need approximately 420 to 475 meters 80 to 90 grams of yarn for bottom border abbreviations k = knit p = purl sl1k = slip one stitch as if to knit sm = stitch marker st s = stitch es rli = with right needle lift stitch below stitch on left needle place on left needle and knit lifted stitch lli = with left needle lift stitch below stitch you have just knit on right needle and knit lifted stitch kfb = knit into front and back of stitch instructions using 2 75mm 24 inch needles and long tail or your favorite stretchy method loosely cast on cast on 168 180 192 stitches cowl border round 1 place unique stitch marker to mark beginning of round knit to end of round be careful not to twist stitches round 2 purl round 3 knit round 4
